body: It also seems to just _not work_ at all some times... In the same sanbox, sometimes I get no error when I press submit, even though it should always produce an error.
That's expected @Nickman87, we cache validation schema and resolver. if you want to change resolver you can toggle the logic in same the function.

Ok, I can manage that with the resolver solution.
I noticed that in my sandbox, when you do a full page reload, the validation does not work, only after doing an internal refresh (in the sandbox browser page). That does not seem like a correct flow?

Also, it might be usefull to add to the documentation which properties are cached, and which cause a reflow?

> Also, it might be usefull to add to the documentation which properties are cached, and which cause a reflow?

Yes, sure feel free to provide your suggestion or send a PR as well.

i notice in your example you are doing a curry, i think you want to send data via `validationContext`.

similar question here as well: https://spectrum.chat/react-hook-form/help/useformcontext-and-errors~41a32449-970d-4094-82e2-e4d2564fc64e
just a quick follow up here, how did you go with the issue?

@bluebill1049 Thanks for the feedback, I have not yet had a chance to revisit my code to implement a workaround.
I will probably get around to doing this by the end of the week and will post back here!
awesome @Nickman87 looking forward for your feedback :)
going to close this issue for now. feel free to follow this up tho.
hmmm good point @Nickman87 thanks for the update. let me take a look why i am caching the context.

oh i see, why i did that... if i am not caching that variable, then the user will need to provide a memorised version of it which is annoying in terms of DX. however it should worked with validationContext when you are changing them with each render. do you have a CSB to demonstrate the issue?

The ref never gets updated, so it will not pass on the new context value?
https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/blob/96468de91c73dd8b562d6f81e0501d26d468e896/src/useForm.ts#L108

Here is a sandbox: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-validationresolver-ke2fo

It should print out "It works" after about 2 seconds when you press the submit button.
I understand the reasoning of caching the data for the users, but it does provide less flexibility.
Also, it seems like the validationContextRef is never used as a "dependency" of any hooks, so it will not trigger any side effect to just keep track of the new value every render?
You could still put it inside the ref every time, like I did in my solution :).
thanks, @Nickman87 agree with above, I will investigate for a better solution.
Keep up the awesomeness in the the library! :)
thanks @Nickman87 find the fix. will create a PR for it.
